member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject
member.summary: An item on the board: a player, wall, powerup, bomb or extra

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Size
member.summary: Size of the object on the board
member.remarks: Note that these are game, not animation coordinates. A player's size will thus be (1, 1), even though it is probably displayed larger.

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.PlayerIndex
member.summary: The player that this object belongs to (or represents), or -1 if none
member.remarks: This is used to identify players and to choose the right color for drawing them and their items

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new board object with the given size at the given position and belonging to the specified player
member.param: Left coordinate
Top coordinate
Object width
Object height
Index ([0, PlayerCount[) of the player that the object belongs to (or represents), or -1 for player-independent objects

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initialize a new board object with the given size at the given position
member.param: Left coordinate
Top coordinate
Object width
Object height

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Animation
member.summary: The animation that the object is visualized as

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.AnimationState
member.summary: The current state (frame number) of the animation

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Loop
member.summary: Whether the animation loops
member.value: true if the animation should be looped endlessly, false if the animation should be played only once
member.remarks: An object with a non-looping animation is destroyed in when the animation is finished

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Animate(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increase the animation state
member.param: The game's animation list
Number of animation ticks that have passed
member.returns: true if the animation should go on, false if the object should be removed from the board

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.GetSprite(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationList,BomberStuff.Core.UserInterface.IDevice)
member.summary: Get a sprite to draw for this object on the specified device
member.param: The game's animation list
The device to get a sprite for
member.returns: The sprite the draw

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.GetOffset(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationList)
member.summary: Get the current animation frame's offset
member.returns: The coordinates of the object's relative to the top left corner of the current animation frame

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.GetSpriteSize(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationList)
member.summary: Get the current animation frame's size
member.param: The game's animation list
member.returns: The size of the object's current animation frame

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Tick(BomberStuff.Core.Board,System.Int32)
member.summary: Handle a number of game ticks
member.param: The board that the object is on
The number of game ticks that have passed
member.remarks: All MobileObject's implementation does here is moving. Derived classes should override this function if they need to handle game ticks. base.Tick() must be called in the overridden function in this case.

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.SpeedX
member.summary: The object's horizontal speed in fields per game tick
member.value: A positive value that represents the object's "potential" speed if it were moving

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.SpeedY
member.summary: The object's vertical speed in fields per game tick
member.value: A positive value that represents the object's "potential" speed if it were moving

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.SetMoveState(BomberStuff.Core.Directions,BomberStuff.Core.Directions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the primary and secondary direction of the object and whether it is moving
member.param: Primary direction
Secondary direction
true if the object is moving, false otherwise
member.remarks: Derived classes that require different animations depending on whether the object moves or on the movement direction should override this. base.SetMoveState must be called in that case.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.SetMoveState(BomberStuff.Core.Directions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the direction of the object and whether it is moving
member.param: Object's direction
true if the object is moving, false otherwise
member.remarks: The object's secondary direction is set to as well to imply that there is no secondary direction

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.MoveX(BomberStuff.Core.Board,System.Single)
member.summary: Try to move the object in X direction
member.returns: the new X coordinate

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.MoveY(BomberStuff.Core.Board,System.Single)
member.summary: Try to move the object in Y direction

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Collide(BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, handles collision with another object.
member.param: the object with which a collision is occuring
member.returns: false if the object can move on, true if the collision caused the object to stop

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.BorderCollide
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, handles collision with the board border. Any required actions, such as bouncing, should be initiated.

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Position
member.summary: Coordinates of the object's top left corner
member.remarks: Note that these are game, not animation coordinates. A player's "Position" will thus be somewhere around his waist.

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.X
member.summary: The object's Left coordinate

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Y
member.summary: The object's top coordinate

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Width
member.summary: The object's width

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Height
member.summary: The object's height

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Bounds
member.summary: The rectangle that the object spans on the board

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.Direction
member.summary: The direction in which the object is primarily moving

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.MobileObject.SecondaryDirection
member.summary: The secondary direction in which the object is moving
member.remarks: If the object hits anything and has to stop in the primary direction, this is swapped with Direction

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Bomb.Explode(BomberStuff.Core.Board)
member.summary: Lets the bomb explode

member.summary: Initialize the user interface
member.returns: true on success, false otherwise

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.UserInterface.IUserInterface.MainLoop
member.remarks: This method is not expected to return until the user interface was in some way terminated, either by calling Terminate(), or by an action such as closing the window.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.UserInterface.IUserInterface.Terminate
member.summary: Finalize the user interface
member.remarks: This should close the interface, clean up all of its resources and cause to return.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.UserInterface.IUserInterface.Draw(BomberStuff.Core.UserInterface.ISprite,BomberStuff.Core.Drawing.PointF,BomberStuff.Core.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.Color)
member.remarks: Shall only be called from the Render event handler

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.UserInterface.IUserInterface.CacheAllSprites
member.summary: Boolean value specifying whether all sprites should be cached (true), or only the most important ones (false)

member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant
member.summary: Represents a participant in a game

remarks.para: This class represents a participant, which can in turn be able to control zero (spectator) or more BombDudes (players) in the game.
In a server-based network game, each client is a participant from the server's perspective, while each client sees only itself and the server as participants.
In a peer to peer game, each client sees itself and every other client as a participant
Important: The results of a public method call, as well as every event must be idempotent!

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.Players
member.summary: The players that this participant controls

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.HasAuthority
member.summary: Is the participant authorized to make changes to the board other than its own dudes' actions? This applies to the server normally, or to everyone in peer-to-peer games

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new participant
member.param: boolean value specifying whether the participant has authority, that is, whether it can control more than just its players' movement

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.ControlsPlayer(BomberStuff.Core.Player)
member.summary: Returns whether the given player is controlled by this participant
member.returns: true if this participant controls , false otherwise

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.ControlsPlayer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns whether the given player is controlled by this participant
member.param: Index of the player to check
member.returns: true if this participant controls , false otherwise

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.StartNegotiation
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is called to notify the participant that game negotiation begins
member.remarks: After receiving this, the participant should raise the Negotiate event to state its preferences. This can be done from inside the method, if possible.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.StartRound(BomberStuff.Core.Player[])
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is called to notify the participant that the game round starts
member.param: the players that the participant owns
member.remarks: Receiving this means negotiation is complete, subsequent Negotiate events will be ignored.

member.name: E:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.Negotiate
member.summary: Signals the preferences of the participant during negotiation phase
member.remarks: This should be raised (once) between receiving the StartNegotiation and StartRound notifications

member.name: E:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.MovePlayer
member.summary: Signales that the specified player (owned by the participant, unless the participant has authority) is changing its movement

member.name: E:BomberStuff.Core.Game.Participant.PlayerAction
member.summary: Signales that the specified player (owned by the participant, unless the participant has authority) is doing an action (placing a bomb, pulling the trigger, ...)

member.summary: The tileset number

member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.ErrorHandling
member.summary: Centralized methods for displaying and handling errors in the program

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.ErrorHandling.FatalError(System.Exception,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Handle an expected, but fatal error. Outputs a user-readable message an may or may not terminate the program.
member.param: an exception related to the error, or null
an error message format string
arguments for the message format

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.ErrorHandling.UnexpectedError(System.Exception,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Handle an unexpected fatal error. Outputs a user-readable message and may prompt the user to report the error. May or may not terminate the program.
member.param: an exception related to the error, or null
an error message format string
arguments for the message format

member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder
member.summary: A wrapper object providing functionality for creating raw bitmap data from different image formats

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.BitmapHeaderSize
member.summary: The size of a bitmap file header

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.PaletteSize
member.summary: The size of the bitmap's palette

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.PaletteLocation
member.summary: The index into the BitmapData array at which the palette starts, if present

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.DataLocation
member.summary: The index into the BitmapData array at which the image data starts

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.#ctor(BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder)
member.summary: Copy constructor. Performs a shallow copy, and creates a new, blank array of previous size in BitmapData

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.#ctor(System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Constructor that creates the byte array required to hold a bitmap file with the specified properties and initializes the bitmap header information
member.param: Number of bits per pixel in the bitmap.
The width of the bitmap image
The height of the bitmap image
member.remarks: Bitmap images support values of 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 or 32. Images with less than 16 bits per pixel will need a palette of 2^bpp 32-bit entries, which is allocated by the constructor.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.GetStream
member.summary: Creates a new backed by the BuildmapBuilder's bitmap data
member.returns: a Stream that will provide bitmap data
member.remarks: This method's return value is primarily intended for use with or similar (for example Texture creation) functions

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadPaletteFromBitmap(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a bitmap-format palette from the specified and inserts it into the bitmap data
member.param: the Stream to read the palette from
member.remarks: This will read a constant amount of bytes. The caller needs to make sure that this amount of data is available.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadPaletteFromPCX(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a PCX-format palette from the specified and inserts it into the bitmap data
member.param: the Stream to read the palette from
member.remarks: TRYTRY: this should read PaletteSize bytes

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadPaletteFromPCX(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads a PCX-format palette from a Stream with the help of the specified and inserts it into the bitmap data
member.param: the BinaryReader to read the palette with
member.remarks: TRYTRY: this should read PaletteSize bytes

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadDataFromAni(System.IO.Stream,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Reads the actual image data from a Stream with the help of the specified and insert it into the bitmap data
member.param: the Stream to read the data from
the maximum number of bytes to be read from the stream. Pass if there is no limit
member.returns: A positive number of bytes read from the stream if successful, the negative of the number of bytes read on failure, zero if no bytes have been read.
member.remarks: The data will be read using the Run-length-encoding format used in Atomic bomberman ANI files, which is (exactly?) the same as that used in TGA files.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes of the object's unmanaged and optionally managed resources
member.param: true to free managed resources

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the object's managed and unmanaged resources

member.summary: Finalizer. Disposes of unmanaged resources

member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo
member.summary: The ColorRemapInfo structure contains information about how a color is to be remapped, including a hue and saturation as well as a lightness difference setting

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.SetHue
member.summary: A boolean value specifying whether or not to perform hue remapping

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.NewHue
member.summary: The new hue to remap to, if hue remapping is performed

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.SetSaturation
member.summary: A boolean value specifying whether or not to perform saturation remapping

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.NewSaturation
member.summary: The new saturation to remap to, if saturation remapping is performed

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.DiffLightness
member.summary: The lightness difference to apply during remapping

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new ColorRemapInfo specifying that hue should be remapped to the specified value
member.param: destination hue value for remapping

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new ColorRemapInfo specifying that saturation and lightness should be remapped to the specified values
member.param: destination saturation value for remapping
lightness difference for remapping

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new ColorRemapInfo specifying that hue, saturation and lightness should be remapped to the specified values
member.param: destination hue value for remapping
destination saturation value for remapping
lightness difference for remapping

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new ColorRemapInfo specifying a lightness difference and whether hue and saturation should be remapped, as well as the values they should be remapped to, if any
member.param: destination hue. Ignored if is false
destination saturation. Ignored if is false
member.remarks: This overload is provided for . For creating remap info structures from other code, you should use one of the more convenient overloads.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of this object
member.returns: A String representing this ColorRemapInfo

member.summary: Provides color remapping of animation states

member.summary: The source hue value that shall be remapped

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapper.Remap(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationFrame,BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo)
member.summary: Remaps all pixels in the specified sequence state's frame that have a hue value of OriginalHue 45 (and a lightness less than 340) to the new values specified by changes
member.param: the animation frame is frame is to be remapped
a ColorRemapInfo specifying the destination color range
member.returns: A remapped copy of the frame, or the original frame if nothing is to be done
member.remarks: This is an O(width*height) operation - and pixel operations are slow! If no changes are specified in , or if only a hue change with the original hue and new hue being the same is specified, the source frame is returned.
